alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 11 at 1:35PM PST until March 15 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Winter Storm Warning extended through Wednesday to include impacts from the next storm Tuesday into Wednesday. * WHAT...Snow expected. Snow accumulations through Monday of 3 to 8 inches above 5500 feet, except 1 to 3 feet above 6500 feet. For Tuesday lower elevation areas receiving up to 2 inches including around Susanville. 6 to 12 inches west of 395 below 6000 feet, with 1 to 2 feet above 6000 feet. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible at times. Heavy snow accumulations could cause tree damage and lead to power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will vary between 5500 to 6000 feet through Monday, then rise between 6500 to 7000 feet Tuesday afternoon before falling below 5000 feet Wednesday morning. The heaviest snowfall rates are expected on Tuesday.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
